 do some prepartions: Switch to "pose" controller mode and set default velocities first:
tuple faa = hand.GetFingerActualAngle( iFinger )

tuple t = hand.MoveFinger( iFinger, False )

Variable Documentation

string demo-simple2.__author__ = "Dirk Osswald: dirk.osswald@de.schunk.com"
string demo-simple2.__copyright__ = "Copyright (c) 2007 SCHUNK GmbH & Co. KG"
string demo-simple2.__doc__
Initial value:
00001 '''
00002 Very simple python demo script using the sdh package.
00003 Will move first finger 3 times between current position and current position-10.
00004 The movement will be stopped in the middle of the movement.
00005 
00006 - Example usage:
00007   - Make SDH connected connected via Ethernet move:
00008     The SDH has IP-Address 192.168.1.42 and is attached to TCP port 23.
00009     (Requires at least SDH-firmware v0.0.3.1)
00010     > demo-simple2.py --tcp=192.168.1.42:23 
00011      
00012   - Make SDH connected to port 2 = COM3 move:
00013     > demo-simple2.py -p 2
00014      
00015   - Make SDH connected to USB to RS232 converter 0 move:
00016     > demo-simple2.py --sdh_rs_device=/dev/ttyUSB0
00017      
00018   - Get the version info of both the joint controllers and the tactile 
00019     sensor firmware from an SDH connected via Ethernet. 
00020     The SDH and the tactile sensors have a common IP-Address,
00021     here 192.168.1.42. The joint controller is attached to the
00022     TCP port 23 and the tactile sensors to TCP port 13000.
00023     (Requires at least SDH-firmware v0.0.3.2)
00024     > demo-simple2.py --tcp=192.168.1.42:23 --dsa_tcp=:13000 -v
00025 
00026   - Get the version info of both the joint controllers and the tactile 
00027     sensor firmware from an SDH connected to:
00028     - port 2 = COM3 (joint controllers) and 
00029     - port 3 = COM4 (tactile sensor controller) 
00030     > demo-simple2.py --port=2 --dsaport=3 -v
00031 '''

00001 sdh.cSDHOptionParser( usage    =  __doc__ + "\nusage: %prog [options]",
00002                                revision = __version__ )
